11111112222211.content:
Like other usual potty training charts, the caretakers/teachers use a symbols to represent if students stay clean or not. The chart itself are drawn to the top of the chalkboard out of kids reach so that no kid can tamper with the chart with a long text written in white chalk explaining the symbols that can be interpret as this

Bright yellow smiling sun : No accidents occur that day
Blue raindrop : someone made a tinkle in their pants
Brown mud : a case of stinky

Looking at your chart you are proud that your entire row are filled with smiley sun symbols, save for a couple of raindrops and mud during the first two weeks of the preschool as you recall unable to find the bathroom in time. And a muddy icon a week ago because you ate too much and got sick, ending up having the accident and had to be sent home that day. Today's Friday and you look at your weekly charts, Seeing a row of sunny up to Thursday as you keep your garments clean for almost an entire week... Barely. Unbeknownst to other, you had been struggling with a lot of close calls as the urges to use the potty you can feel are often almost too late and always left with small stains (or streaks) that teacher doesn't really notice (They don't have time to thoroughly check fifty students at once).

Turning away from the board about to walk to the playpen you..
11111112222211.title: ...mostly good, with some exceptions.

Your name is Gizelle. You are a fairly typical 7 year old girl who loves the color pink, watches Disney Channel, and loves to do dance. You live at home with your older brother, Max, who is 12 years old and younger sister, Tina, who is 4 years old. Overall, you live a pretty good life.

"Wake up, honey," your mom says, stirring you from a great dream. Looking around, you realize it's another school day. You go about getting ready for the day. You brush your teeth, comb your hair, and pick out a pink shirt and jeans to wear to school. You check your backpack to make sure you have your homework and everything else you need for school before hurrying downstairs for breakfast.

After eating breakfast, you head off to school. The day is going by fairly normal. You start the day with language arts and then go onto science. After science comes your favorite class of the day, math! When you get to math though, you realize today won't be your favorite as your teacher greets the class.

"Good morning my friends," your teacher begins as she does every morning. "As I told you yesterday, we will be taking a test in class today. Please remember, that during a test, you keep your eyes on your paper, there is no talking, and people will only be allowed to leave in an emergency. And yes, Albert (as his hand shot into the air), the restroom can be an emergency."

You had completely forgotten that there was a test in math today, but still you were fairly confident, but a little nervous. As you were taking the test, you started to feel the urge to go to the restroom. Sitting there, you saw that you were about half way done, so you were not overly concerned about it and continued on. Time ticked by slowly, and as you finished the test, the urge had gotten really bad. As you raise your hand in the air, shaking a little, Ms. Turner (the teacher), walks over.

"All done Gizelle?" She questions you looking over your test.

"Yes ma'am and I really have to go to the restroom," you say bouncing up and down in your seat.

Taking your test, Ms. Turner reminds you to take the bathroom pass and go. Hurrying out the classroom, you don't pay attention to the fact that your shoes are untied and make a beeline straight for the restrooms. Unfortunately, being the oldest kids in this wing, you have to walk to the opposite end of the wing. Moving at a half walk, half run, you turn the final corner and, boom! You walk right into a much larger person, causing you to lose balance and fall to the floor.

"What's the hurry kiddo?" comes the voice from above you. Looking up, you realized you walked right into Mrs. Duncan, the principal. She reaches down to start to help you up as you realize, you lost concentration and have wet your pants.

"Oh my, I am so sorry sweetie," she says, putting an arm around your shoulder as you begin to cry. "Let's get you over to the nurses office."

The principal walks you over to the nurses office and sits you down on one of the chairs. You are so upset, you don't hear what she is saying as she goes off to talk to the school nurse.

"Giselle, do you have a change of clothes in your backpack?" Startling you from your zoned out state, the nurse questions you. You just shake your head no, the nurse goes off and rummages through some things and comes out with a pair of jeans that look just like yours. "Hmm, no underwear in those sizes, let's call mom."

Going back to her desk, she types on her computer and then picks up the phone.

"Good morning, is this Mrs. Castro," the nurse asks the person on the other line who must have confirmed it because the nurse continued, " We have Gizelle here in the nurses office and she has had a little accident."

You hear the person on the phone speak, but you can't make out what she is saying.

"She's fine, just a little shaken up. I found out that she doesn't have a change of clothes in her bag. I looked through our clothes and found that we do have a change of pants and a shirt that will fit, but no underwear."

Your mom starts to speak again, but it is impossible to make out what she is saying.

"Wow, you are two hours away at that meeting. We could have her go without, but that is highly unsanitary. The other option is that we do have some diapers and Pull Ups for some of the youngsters, but I only do that as a last resort."

The nurse stops as your mother begins again.

"Alright, I will see what we can do." and she hangs up the phone. Coming out from behind her desk, she goes over to a different cabinet and unlocks the door. Opening it up, you see a couple packages that you recognize from the baby aisle of the store. Looking over her shoulder, she motions you to an alcove with an examination table, "Why don't you head in there to take off those wet clothes."

Doing as you are told, you pull the curtain closed. As you begin to remove the clothes, you hear her continue to rummage and mumble, "I swore we had some in here, oh well, guess we are out," as the cupboard closes. The nurse comes into the alcove to help you out.

"Giselle, your mother is a few hours away and there was no one else in town who could come and help out. I explained our options to your mom who agreed to do what we needed. Unfortunately, this was all I could find in your size," she states as she holds up a pampers (you recognize it from your sister's night diapers).

She pats the table for you to come lay down. You start to sob as you walk over and lie down. The nurse works quickly and you are strapped in that diaper before you can resist. She helps you to your feet as you look down and realize you look just like your little sister. The nurse helps you into the pants and shirt and sends you on your way back to class.

Walking back to class, it feels weird to be walking in a diaper, but you are fairly certain no one will notice.

Almost immediately the other kids took notice. Timmy got the crowd started. He pointed and laughed at you, a seven year old little girl still in diapers, what a puerile sight!

Soon it seemed the whole playground was pointing and laughing at you. Every finger so cruelly pointed at your butt felt like a little knife going into your tender heart. Every laugh was like the wails of the damned tormenting your ears. You began crying.

"Because it's fun." She said.
Maxine got an evil grin and raised her foot. She swung her leg hard and kicked dirt and dust in your face. You coughed and cried, dirt now in your eyes. The other kids joined in. Soon several kids were kicking dirt on you. Some were even spitting on you too.
"Help me! Help me!" You screamed out.
You saw a teacher, and older woman. It was Mrs. Madison. You gave her a desperate, sad look. She ignored you. In fact, all the teachers on the playground seemed to know exactly what was going on, and not a single one did anything about it. You shielded your face from the dirt and cried.

An older boy in the crowd grabbed you by the shoulders and began dragging you across the playground. A Maxine and another girl grabbed your legs. You struggled at first, but soon realized they had totally overpowered you. A couple smaller kids hurled rocks at you as you went.
"Come on, baby! Upsie-daisy!" The boy said.
They carried you to the side and hurled you into the bushes. You felt like you were being poked by a hundred little sticks and you hit your head and your arms and legs on the bush's limbs. Your shirt was ripped, your hair was a mess, your pants were gone, you were covered in dirt, and your arms and legs were covered in cuts and bruises. Truly this was rock-bottom for you, sobbing under the bushes alone and afraid. Worst of all, somewhere along the line you had wet your diaper. You sobbed and bawled for the rest of recess until the bell rang to go back to class. Once the rest of the kids were off the playground you brought up the courage to return to your classroom.

You ran through the halls right into Mrs.Turner's room.
"Gizelle! You're late!" She said, glaring at you.
A couple kids were giggling at you, seeing your wet diaper.
"But... But... I was bullied! Maxine and Timmy and a bunch of other kids beat me up and threw me in a bush!" You shouted, crying hysterically again.

Mrs. Turner did in fact dislike tattletales and didn't have much sympathy for bullying victims. In fact, it seemed the school tended to blame victims for being such good bullying targets.

Sobbing, you went back into the hallway to the nurse's office. Maxine and Timmy were being mean, and yet you got detention. Truly there was no justice in this world.

info.brief_description: Inspired from the long deleted interactive stories.
info.description:
well... like subtitle say. This interactive fiction was mainly focused on potty contents.

Thing to note before you add new chapter.
1.There's (almost) no limit about character getting in a potty situation, you can write pretty much what you want as long as it doesn't go extremely graphic.
2.No sexual content allowed. Please. We are trying to keep story not going to Rated R
3.If you are going to add choice chapter, make sure you put in some detail, not just a "And he pick a?" Thingy.
4.Please avoid profanities, please.
5.The (main) stories are focusing on children.
6.Stay in the character [in another word : don't turn six years old into Einstein]
7.No nudity allowed
